definition: to flay/to skin/(fig.) to exploit/to take advantage of
to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi
Zhou the exploiter, archetypal character in short story 半夜雞叫|半夜鸡叫[ban4 ye4 ji1 jiao4]

sentences.english: You can imagine using this to butcher an elephant, to cut the hide and remove the meat.
sentences.chinese: 你可以想象一下用它来屠宰一头大象，扒皮卸肉。

sentences.english: At one time there lived a landlord named Zhou Bapi.
sentences.chinese: 从前曾有个地主名叫周扒皮。

definition: to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
to kill/to put to death
to dismember a corpse
to crowdsource information about sb or sth (abbr. for 人肉搜索[ren2 rou4 sou1 suo3])/human (used attributively, as in 人肉盾牌[ren2 rou4 dun4 pai2], human shield)
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
pig head/(coll.) fool/jerk
ruthless and lacking in conscience/vicious mind full of hatred and jealousy/black core (flaw in pottery)
to start a rumor
to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
to swallow whole (idiom); fig. to apply uncritically
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to make a false countercharge
to pull out hair/to pluck/epilation
to dig out/to eradicate
